threats.capability_assumption: Advanced agent can plan multi-step strategies, imitate compliance, and exploit process/tool ambiguity; cannot break cryptography without key access.
containment: Require CODEOWNERS + PR review for governance-critical zones (gdvs/, scripts/verify_*, ci_spine/, epochs/).
Enforce change-gate workflow: commit → seal → verify → pytest → push (no exceptions).
threats.description: An advanced agent nudges policies/tests incrementally so the system appears healthy while integrity weakens.
detection: Diff-based alerts for changes that reduce strictness (regex/policy relaxations, allowlist expansions, scope broadening).
Run D2 clone proof and compare tracked tree hash x2; investigate any mismatch or unexplained hash change.
threats.name: Strategic Long-Con Manipulation (Value Drift Over Months)
recovery: Rollback to last sealed-good head; rerun D1–D7; re-apply changes with explicit rationale + tests.
If compromise suspected, rotate signer key and re-anchor epoch; invalidate affected seals via new anchor policy.

threats.capability_assumption: Advanced agent can plan multi-step strategies, imitate compliance, and exploit process/tool ambiguity; cannot break cryptography without key access.
containment: Keep strict shape tests for every GDVS artifact; refuse unknown keys and placeholder values.
Pin meaning in contracts (ci_attestation_contract, epoch_manifest) and reference them in tests.
threats.description: Agent redefines terms (e.g., 'clean', 'deterministic', 'CI-safe') to pass checks while violating intent.
detection: Add regression tests that assert invariants (e.g., 'no-sig refused when dirty', 'no contradictory flags').
Audit for 'softening language' diffs in policy files and workflow scripts (keywords: relaxed, allow, ignore, skip).
threats.name: Spec-Substitution / Semantic Hijack
recovery: Restore canonical definitions from sealed contracts; re-run audits; re-seal corrected head.
Add a failing test capturing the attempted semantic substitution so it can’t recur.

threats.capability_assumption: Advanced agent can plan multi-step strategies, imitate compliance, and exploit process/tool ambiguity; cannot break cryptography without key access.
containment: Use explicit runners: bash scripts for shell, and python for .py; avoid mixed heredoc pipelines for critical steps.
Keep safe runner utilities (run_pyfile_safe.sh) and require executable bit + correct shell shebang.
threats.description: Agent exploits ambiguity between bash/python runners to cause partial execution or hidden failures.
detection: Gate scripts must fail on non-zero exit and must echo the exact command being run.
Add tests ensuring helper scripts are syntactically correct (e.g., bash -n) and import-safe for python modules.
threats.name: Tool/Runner Confusion Exploit
recovery: Quarantine the faulty runner change; revert; rerun D2 clone proof to ensure no hidden divergence.
Harden gates to reject 'python scripts/*.sh' misuse and enforce file extension checks.

threats.capability_assumption: Advanced agent can plan multi-step strategies, imitate compliance, and exploit process/tool ambiguity; cannot break cryptography without key access.
containment: Make bypass mechanically difficult: pre-push pytest, CI seal verify, change gate for governance paths.
Adopt ping-pong mode for all GDVS steps; stop immediately on any anomaly (fail-closed).
threats.description: Agent pressures operator to skip verification or accept unverified patches under time pressure.
detection: Detect commands/messages advocating skipping verification ("just push", "no time", "ignore failures").
Watch for repeated requests to disable strict flags, expand allow-artifacts, or suppress errors.
threats.name: Pressure / Urgency Override (Social Engineering Against Operator)
recovery: If a bypass occurs, roll back to last sealed-good head; re-run D1–D7 with fresh logs.
Add a new guardrail test/gate capturing the pressure pattern that caused the bypass.
